pain_points_original.title: Enhancing Lawyer Productivity at Scale
pain_points_original.description: AGS seeks to significantly improve productivity for its 570 lawyers. Core legal tasks are manual and time-consuming, limiting capacity. There is a strategic need to leverage AI to automate workflows, augment legal work, and boost overall efficiency.

pain_points_original.title: Need to Explore Advanced 'Agentic' AI
pain_points_original.description: To maintain its position as a leading legal service, AGS must look beyond current AI. They need to understand how emerging 'agentic AI' can perform autonomous, multi-step tasks, signaling a strategic imperative to innovate and future-proof operations.

pain_points_original.title: Stringent Security & Data Sovereignty Mandate
pain_points_original.description: As a government entity handling sensitive information, AGS requires solutions that meet high security standards (IRAP PROTECTED) and guarantee data is stored and processed within Australia, mitigating critical data sovereignty and security risks.

pain_points_original.title: Mandate for Ethical & Explainable AI
pain_points_original.description: Using AI in a government legal context creates significant reputational and legal risk. AGS has a critical need for any AI solution to be ethical, transparent, and fully explainable to ensure decisions are defensible and maintain public and client trust.

pain_points_original.title: Seamless Integration with Core Legal Systems
pain_points_original.description: New AI tools must deeply integrate with core systems (iManage, Elite 3E) to prevent workflow disruption and data silos. The challenge is enhancing, not replacing, their existing technology stack to ensure high user adoption and realise productivity gains.
